description: Array (a frieze pattern) defined by a(n,k) = (a(n-1,k)*a(n-1,k+1) - 1) / a(n-2,k+1), read by antidiagonals.
formula: a(n, k)=(n+k)*a(n-1, k)-a(n-2, k) with a(0, k)=1 and a(-1, k)=0. - _Henry Bottomley_, Feb 28 2001a(n, k) = Pi*(BesselJ(n+k+1, 2)*BesselY(k, 2) - BesselY(n+k+1, 2)*BesselJ(k, 2)). - Alec Mihailovs (alec(AT)mihailovs.com), Aug 21 2005Column asymptotics (i.e. for fixed k and n -> infinity): a(n, k) ~ BesselJ(k, 2)*(n+k)!. - Alec Mihailovs (alec(AT)mihailovs.com), Aug 21 2005
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 28 2000
extensions: More terms from _Christian G. Bower_, Dec 02 2000
